description: Code identifying the maintenance task/template this schedule controls; links to task master details.
Ordinal number of the schedule definition for the task, allowing multiple schedules per task.
Execution or ordering sequence used when multiple schedule lines/steps exist for the same task.
Identifier of the targeted asset or asset group key for this schedule; mixed formats suggest both are stored—confirm with SME.
Asset category/class this schedule applies to, or 'Group' when the schedule targets multiple assets.
Count of assets covered by the schedule when applied to a group.
Date and time the scheduled task was last completed for the asset or group.
Next calendar date the task is planned to become due.
Meter/odometer reading captured when the task was last completed.
Meter/odometer threshold at which the next occurrence will become due.
Index or number of the upcoming recurrence for this schedule; exact semantics may vary—confirm with SME.
Flag indicating the schedule is paused and should not trigger new work automatically.
User ID that created this schedule record.
Timestamp when this schedule record was created.
User ID that last modified this schedule record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this schedule record.
Indicates the target is an asset group rather than a single asset (boolean/1-0 style flag).
Identifier of an active preventive-maintenance work order linked to this schedule.
Work order number associated with the most recent completion of this scheduled task.
Indicates whether the task is currently due, considering calendar, meter, and work-order status.
Date/time the most recent work order tied to this schedule was created.
Reference ID linking this schedule to stored attachments or external documents; confirm integration source.
Human-readable explanation of current due status or blocking condition.
Temporary due indicator used during recalculation or staging; may not reflect final persisted status—confirm with SME.
Temporary status message corresponding to the temporary due indicator; used during evaluation—confirm with SME.
Additional free-text notes or instructions for the scheduled task.
Default assignee (user, team, or vendor) for work generated by this schedule.
Indicates whether this task is dependent on another task’s completion before becoming due; confirm with SME.
Cost allocation details for sharing expenses across assets, departments, or cost centers; confirm with SME.
Supplemental description text included on generated work orders; meaning of 'AW' should be confirmed with SME.
